description: Borrowed from Hebrew קְהִילָּה‎ (qəhîllâ, “a community, a congregation”).

nouns.description: kehillah (plural kehillahs or kehillot or kehilloth)

entries.meaning: (Judaism) A type of Jewish community in eastern Europe.
(Judaism) Any Jewish community; especially, a secular Jewish communal organization, or the secular dimension of a religious one.
